WGbovZHpab5Em7kAgiLCSQ.text: It's so hard to find good pizza and pasta that are gluten free. This place was amazing, I couldn't tell it was gluten free.  I would go back for sure. I'm used to scouring the area for a place that offers even one item gluten free. You can go in here and order anything you'd like. I even had Tiramisu and I never even order dessert.

5AWtqf2ekC1y2vtHo1mUnQ.text: So I was on the hunt for homemade wheat free/gluten free pizza and came across Cotto. It's not far from my place on the train so we headed out there for dinner. We were greeted by the owner with a giant basket of freshly baked bread, which I turned down because of my wheat allergy and the owner said, "You must tell me right away, I will take care of you!" and he had some fresh and hot gluten-free bread brought to me right away. What a treat!!!! This is a fantastic Italian family owned establishment with all the charm and fantastic service that you find in Italy. And the food! Superb! My husband had the Penne Arrabiata, and I had a Gluten Free Vegetarian Pizza. Both were absolutely excellent. The veggies on the pizza were crispy and delicious, the sauce and cheese were wonderful and the crust was crispy around the edges. The owner took the time to have about a 20 min chat with us, inquiring about my allergy and telling us that he had been Celiac for many years. I could not fit dessert into my preggy tummy, but my husband had the mint and chocolate ice cream which was spectacular! I had a bite, and I've never had ice cream that was as light as a mousse. Brilliantly done. Not only that, but over half the desserts on the menu were gluten free. Not just the typical gluten free fare either...they had tiramisu for goodness sake! I highly recommend this restaurant for WF and GF as well as non-allergy folk as well! It's a nice friendly laid back atmosphere, reasonably priced, and caters to those of us who are normally left out when it comes to Italian fare! Go there now! x

6wHRMsnhpBXuNHCMFmJWXQ.text: Loved the people.  Fast service for a leisurely town.  Food was good.  : )

_88kWH0_5coOGrvB6Cn3GA.text: From the second we walked we were met with the warmest welcome. With gorgeous olives delivered to our table along with the service we received and the best pizza in London, I am by far recommending this beautiful establishment to everyone!!

HACkqO-zB0QXZyfdN6FnOg.text: This was just an average italian restaurant. I got the gnocchi and it was pretty tasteless. We ate at the bar and the bartender was really nice, but the food service was just terrible and they secretly charged us without informing us! Will not be returning.

xhgRyrXGj3o175CClmWVjA.text: Simply, we loved it! Both my partner and I are GF and I am also DF (winning double) so finding a place that accommodates both is really difficult. This place is amazing. The owner explained that he is gluten intolerant himself hence why the menu is so extensive! Would recommend to anyone who loves great Italian food.

B6Q3U0v-AvfMkoswfkhpwA.text: Excellent service and food, really a recommendation!If I have to give one down point, it would be that out main dish was a little small. Actually, if we didn't take a starter, it would have been to little to satisfy.

D_eEVkIzgfF_aL8zpN8y7Q.text: I love this place, family run classic Italian joint. The food is always fresh, tasty, cooked to perfection and served with a BIG smile. They also cater for Gluten intolerance which i have never seen anywhere else in London. Well located 5 minutes walk from waterloo. The house red is a lovely smooth drop - perfect to wash down the divine Tiramisu. Well worth a visit, ive been back multiple times and it wont be long until the next visit.

raHhMqjN21wn5FMZAbcQUA.text: Went here with my aunt for gluten free options. Her GF pizza and pasta were just as tasty as my normal tortellini! The food was just fantastic and the owner and staff were very friendly.  I couldn't recommend Cotto highly enough!

Q2vRHnmN7pbFQi27WRgW-A.text: I can't even begin to say how amazing this place is. My husband has a gluten and tomato allergy and the owner completely took care of us. My family is Italian and I can honestly say that this is the best Italian food I've ever had.

BDIbTCstG8QpNbaeeQ9Szg.text: This Gluten free Italian is not to be believed. The food is outstanding! from the Olives mixed with preserved lemons and spicy peppers that arrive immediatley to the incredibly friendly and top notch service. I had the opportunity to visit it twice during our last stay. All dishes come out steaming hot form the kitchen. I recco the risotto and the Tagliatelle with clams.

BRmkGkPnRUqpcGYJSPTt4g.text: This place is a family business: run by a family from Naples (the pizza capital) they have family members working in almost every job at the restaurant and you can hear them speaking Italian to each other. They're excited about food and to have you in their restaurant. For the wheat eaters, my dining companion said the pizza and bread are solid renditions of classic dishes, but I can't comment on that personally.They can get pretty busy on weekend nights, so it can be a good idea to call in advance to reserve a table. Can't hurt to mention if you'll be ordering a gluten-free pizza -- apparently this helps them plan how much to make.Gluten-free notes: This place is gluten-free mecca. Bread, pizza, pasta, you can eat it all! And also, the owner (and perhaps a few other family members) have celiac disease so you know you can order without having to ask a bunch of questions.The menu has two columns on it, one indicating the price for a normal dish and the other indicating the price for the gluten-free version. (For dishes that are naturally gluten-free, the prices are the same. For gluten-free versions of things like pizza, it's a few pounds more to make up for the higher cost of ingredients.)When the Italians do gluten-free, corn is their grain of choice and it shows here. The bread is corn-based (slightly reminiscent of an American cornbread) and they serve it toasted with butter. The cornmeal pizza crust has a great flavor and crunch, though as you could imagine it's a bit heavier than the wheat crust. Still tasty. I heard the gluten-free tiramisu was excellent though I was too stuffed to try it.You'll also find lots to talk about with your fellow diners. The word has gotten out about the gluten-free options here and you'll probably find yourself swapping tips with the table next to you.

g6R6HPdAZske1WtOhdAz_w.text: Oh dear, judging by other people's review of Cotto, I'm clearly a cynical black sheep. I didn't particularly find the "mamma mia, we are genuine Italians" service, all that genuine. I thought it was laid on a little thick for my liking. Perhaps I've been in the city for too long. As for the food, it was alright. Edible, bog standard Italian, but certainly not enough for me to think it was worth paying or coming back for. We chose it because it was close to a venue where the Christmas party was located but sadly, it wasn't to be. The bread was nice though.

V_z6CENZz5YAE2-PU7ingg.text: A real gem. Wonderful homemade food -- top-notch risotto, pasta, and pizza as well as homemade tiramisu and tartufo -- served by a lovely family who care deeply for their customers. Casual place with very good food -- my favorite combination.    The best Italian places to me are not about showiness or presentation - to me, the Italian food experience is great food, humble service, and a warm, human experience.   Cotto and its owner Lino provide this wonderfully.We were surprised at how many customers coming in seemed to be repeats. Additionally, they are able to provide hands-down the best gluten-free Italian meal anywhere because the owner himself is celiac (intolerant of wheat). This made my son, who suffers from celiac, immediately at ease and he requested we eat there again the next night. Not a fancy place, not the place for a 25th anniversary dinner, but wonderful for just about any other occasion.(note: visit date February 2009)

un3GNH_GtljvrR9fx7IipQ.text: LOVED THIS PLACE. We were looking for a relaxed restaurant to meet with some friends on our recent trip back home to the UK (from the US). We'd called a few pubs but they weren't open to having our 15 month old there on a Friday evening (which we understand). We booked Cotto at the last minute and were so pleased. Our daughter had the avocado and prawn starter which was really tasty and substantial. I had the Octopus - and was delighted with the spicey kick. Followed by the lobster pasta - which was enough to fill up by boyfriend after his delicious lamb chops. The house wine was great and our GF friend was very surprised with the range of GF food. The best part of the evening was how fabulous the staff were. Not only at their proper jobs, but they played with our daughter while we ate. They were so friendly with her, she didn't want to leave (or even come back to the table to join us). Will definitely be coming back here on our next trip to the UK.

tWJCVuCzOYfWEFL_BwR2Kw.text: Across the road from Lambeth North tube station, 5mins walk from Waterloo.The cheapest Italian I have ever been to, let alone in London.  The boy and I shared a starter and had a main course each, plus half a bottle of wine for £23!  Tasty, straightforward food.Hilariously moody service (but because it was characterful and amusing, I was ok with it) from the waiters who were all smiles whenever they spoke to a table with children.  A very family friendly place.Not worth a special trip, but if you find yourself in the area in need of a feed, or if you live South of the river and want to go on a very cheap date to cheer up a cold, skint evening (candles-tick, flowers-tick, Italian food-tick) this is worth a go.

8yAilUdqQ2hMnWjMs6xuSg.text: Gluten free heaven! The owner has celiac disease, and almost everything can be made gluten free. They had GF garlic bread, amazing pasta, and tiramisu (which was better than what I had in Italy!). Very friendly and attentive staff. It's walking distance from the London Eye, and I would highly recommend it (especially for anyone who has celiac disease).

Cg_TeFsDj5GkANzPqe-j5w.text: Took my boyfriend here for his birthday - he's a celiac and I wanted to take him somewhere where he wouldn't be restricted by the menu. This was the most widely recommended 'gluten free' friendly restaurant I found, and we were not disappointed! Great food, loved the laid back atmosphere - and the Italian owner kept coming by to check that we liked his food.  Definitely recommend giving it a try. For those on a budget - take note that they do charge you for the bread (though this is the first time my BF has been able to have bread with his meal while eating out!)

_RioMoj4-F1BuIhiS_UBVg.text: Cotto is one of those places I'd walked / bussed / cycled by a zillion times and paid no attention to, set at the intersection of roads leading from Kennington, E&C and Waterloo and right opposite Lambeth North tube station. Inside it's a cosy, very authentic Italian family restaurant with a great menu, lots of good vegetarian options, a whole gluten free section (unheard of in this sort of place!), super friendly staff (a real Italian family!), very reasonably pricing and the most outrageously impressive desserts I've seen in a long time. The tiramisu looks like it's straight out of a posh cookery book - beautiful to look at and oozing with booze - it's a shame my pasta filled me up to much to give it a try! Still, that's what second visits are for...

5WNdjpuruSVTNC6z0O4iIw.text: The best sauce ever! We ate there twice in one week and will go back the next time we return to London. Missing it already. Inexpensive and wonderful food. Make sure you try the olives. Worth the 5 minute walk from Westminster bridge.

SxdPGWYqAfGPwdS1pg2s4w.text: I ordered the gnocci gluten free which were good but the sauce tasted like canned spaghetti O's Yuck. My friends meal was so disgusting. She ordered a dish that had smoked salmon, avocado and prawns. She took a few bites and I did as well. It was covered in a thick sauce that made me wanna vomit. It tasted like thousand island dressing and it was loaded with perhaps the whole bottle. The smoked salmon didnt seem smoked at all and raw. I seriously almost vomited it was so bad. She was disgusted as well. It was by far the worst meal I had while in london. Terrible. The Glutin free bread was good though.

1Qx8uH72sm-toN1hVYkhfQ.text: On a recent trip to London, my girlfriend and I decided to stop in for a quick lunch. I have to say that this is the best Italian food that I have ever had and that is coming from someone who is half Italian. The service was amazing and they made you feel right at home. The owner stopped by every table at least twice during our meal to see if everyone was satisfied. Great food coupled with great service = a 5-star restaurant.

yhhNvlkMiznYLZciHZRLww.text: The owner and manager makes this place great. He is great with kids and very accommodating. The margarita pizza and the penne arrabiata were great! We came back twice during our stay. The house wine was also quite nice.

vQbq_Ip5grGJAq7l27CZSQ.text: Really nice staff. We just landed from the USA and we're staying at Point A hotel. They welcomed us in and the food was so good!

x_DWuzqowxa2IDguo0S5TQ.text: The people there are very friendly, but the food is nothing to write home about. It's very bland. Where I come from, almost all restaurants come with free bread. At this restaurants. They bring around a basket of bread and tell you to pick one. They fail to mention they charge 1 pound for a little tiny slice!! And it was dry... Also, watch the check when they bring it to you, they over charged us AND the table next to us.

AdMHcT5GR_E6J2WFI2blGg.text: Such a scam place for the tourist. Ordered a steak and it was the worst piece of steak crap (if you can call it steak) I ever had. Meat was raw and tasteless. It charges me for the rock-like breads, adds a mandatory 10% tip. 30 pounds for a 8oz steak are you kidding me? stay away from this place.

fSR1tluSe9iQIUaYgXUjVA.text: please do not i say do not come here worst experience ever there food was bad ive eaten italian food before and believe me this was not no italian there bred was super hard seems like it was out for a long time couldnt even chew it very un sanitary plus there coke was watered down there so called lemonade was sparkling water with lime they charge for tap water the waitress was starring too hard while we where eating if there was possible to rate this as a 0 i would rate this a 0 the owner too lazy to get up and attend us they charge for every simple thing super expensive rather go down the stress get me a cold sandwich and a can of coke thats not watered down plain and simple busted ass service busted ass food stay away!!!! do not listen to the people with 5 stars very horrible place

photos.caption: Photo of Cotto - London, United Kingdom

D_HE7v2qFJVIzyesNXy98Q.text: Wonderful dinner on a Friday night in London. We had the caprese salad for appetizer, and the mozzarella was quite good. Entrees were carbonara (excellent!) and prosciutto tortellini (also very good). A bottle of the house red wine was under £15 and suited the food well. We had great conversation with another American couple seated beside us, and the owner/manager was extremely friendly. All in all a great experience, and dinner (with wine) for four came out to about £90 including tip.

Hze46srAUFJkiuoPHVDhCw.text: Nailed it in every category- Owner was so friendly and waiters were extremely helpful! Food was absolutely delicious, as well as being allergy friendly! And the atmosphere was so comforting, God, I just didn't want to leave. On a 3-day trip to London, I heard about this hole in the wall, allergy friendly restaurant with gluten free pasta and other Italian food called Cotto. I have allergies to dairy and eggs, so I figured that I could find something I could have there. I looked up the location on Google Maps and took the Piccadilly Line and transferred to the  Bakerloo Line to Lambeth North. (Very short walk from there, just do that instead of walking all the way from Waterloo). I accidentally came about 15 minutes before opening time that day (6pm) but, even though he was eating, the owner graciously took me to a seat and asked for my order. After telling him about my allergies, he actually decided to make me a special shrimp pasta before anybody came so there was no contamination. While other restaurants have been friendly, they haven't gone this far. I then learned that the owner actually has celiac himself! What a great way to make use of allergies- opening a restaurant with gluten free food for people like yourself! Maybe I should do that one day......

gmZpRDpheQC_Acln-Gb5yQ.text: I am still dreaming about the carbonara I had here in February! It was awesome that they had such a large gluten free menu as I was traveling with celiacs. I am fortunate that I am not limited by that, but this place was a win for both the "regular" pasta and GF pasta crowds. When we walked in we were greeted by who I think was the owner. He was lovely, so friendly and jolly. I can't wait to come back!

Mc6qY29tinXM2Y7tuFOBDw.text: We had the Cotto pizza and it was delicious.  We recommend the restaurant if you would like to enjoy great Italian dishes while in London.  Great casual family restaurant.

FHQe6CYS8Q63HGM5QJVtTw.text: VERY Gluten Free friendly! Food was good. Service was fast and friendly. I highly recommend this restaurant for anyone looking for some good Italian food, gluten free or otherwise. The portions were also quite generous. We will definitely be back in the next time we are in London.

gVijWzcxH0C8qAoTwv3kug.text: I want to live here. The pizza is so insane. Literally my fave ever and I'm a huge pizza fan.

dVhjunKxX-OkHU9R84PQbw.text: I had not read many of the reviews, but saw that they had gluten free, so thought we would try it. We were not disappointed! The owner is Italian and a celiac himself. The food was amazing, the staff attentive, and they seated us immediately without a reservation on a weekend! Even the dessert was amazing! I can't say enough! So good!

ZtwJ76MIu0MeMrY3iR_34w.text: Delicious dinner. My Rigatoni Matrigiana was delicious, as were the pizza my Wife ordered, and my daughter's spaghetti bolognese. We would definitely go back.

PjeSN192-SlQe29TMbA8bw.text: Absolutely love the place! Walking in your feel like you're walking in to your friend's place. The owner is very friendly and chatty. The service is always great and the food is delicious. Highly recommend it

cIssW54fBau0rvqWjiJiUw.text: In my opinion, this is the best place to get food in London. If you're looking for delicious, homemade gluten free Italian dishes, then definitely come here. If you're looking for delicious, homemade fully of gluten Italian dishes, this is also the place for you! (I've taken non-gluten free friends here and they loved it just as much as I do) The quality of the care put into the dishes doesn't waver between the regular and gluten free dishes as is so often the case at other restaurants. The Boccia family will invite you in, make you feel at home, and strive to meet all of your dietary needs. Doesn't get better than that.

X_ObKPsECZ6j5C803ZpNTw.text: Cotto is one of my all-time favorite restaurants on either side of the pond.  Almost the entire menu can be made gluten-free, so there are SO MANY choices, including pizza, pasta, etc. Not only that, they really understand that GF/coeliac/celiac is not a fad and they go to great lengths to keep everything safe and separate (which is not always something you get at Italian chain restaurants).  The place is so welcoming, especially if you are part of the gluten-free tribe. I've had some of the most memorable meals ever here mostly because of the kindness and warmth of the host/owner, Lino. There are garlicky olives to get you started, then bread & butter. I've had the eggplant parm (an appetizer but big enough for a meal), spaghetti bolognese, and gnocchi, all of which were stupendous and all of which are made in-house. The desserts make me weep - gluten free tira misu, panna cotta, or my new true love, the tartufo limoncello, which I will see in my dreams until I come back to London again. If you can't tell already, I just really love this place and it is always a treat to dine here.

photos.caption: Photo of Cotto - London, United Kingdom. Lemon meringue tartufo = heaven!
Photo of Cotto - London, United Kingdom. Huge menu - gluten free & regular.
Photo of Cotto - London, United Kingdom. Cotto

uQWPN4XPGrPIoIe5vV1lmQ.text: This was the BEST Italian I've ever had had as a celiac.  The owner is also a celiac and made an amazing meal for me.  The place is so good I want to fly my celiac mother from the USA to London so she can try it.

IGz4o-yqLyLzuONbVtxoJw.text: Five stars, hands down, for many reasons.As others have mentioned: this is the best guten-free restaurant I've found in London, and the best part was, I found it by complete accident when out with my mostly GF family.We had one of the best service experiences I've had in London: the owner spoke came over to our table when he heard we were ordering GF food, walked us through the menu, checked on us several times, plus the three or four other servers who took care of us. The restaurant wasn't full for a Monday evening, which was nice too.The food itself was deliciouso, both GF and non-GF (I tried the dishes my family ordered). We had wine, and many courses, including a delicious GF dessert that was on par with any "normal" dessert I've had.The only drawback to Cotto is the location, as most people aren't likely to stumble on it, and being on the corner of Westminster Bridge Road probably makes parking a bit tricky. Nonetheless, it's one place I would take anyone looking for GF, as well as anyone looking for "normal" Italian. Bravo!

0PsEVe9Wq-hAtcv5U07qww.text: I guess most of the excited 5-star reviews are from the Gluten-Free crowd. It's awesome that this restaurant has such a wide GF/DF selection, but their "normal" food was just...yeah, A-OK.

2Ed1usFhtK-41dyDJPvEPQ.text: I'm a Canadian Celiac traveling in London who stumbled upon Cotto's to find a Gluten Free oasis. The food is fantastic and the choices are overwhelming. Treat yourself, you'll be so happy that you did. It's worth any effort to get here for a meal.

xSzzuQO5yjzwIAF35QsJgQ.text: Finally got around to eating here, glad I did. If you're looking for fancy-schmanzy Italian food keep walking. This in Italian comfort food, a very large menu with lots of pastas and meats and fish, not to mention some great starters.Pleasant wait staff, the owner always visits each table if he's in, and he usually is. Family run. Not expensive for this pricey town.Good value for money. Enjoy!

cXfTpzGBG9gxcYWBQKoa3A.text: Wonderfully surprised by this gem! The bread was fresh and delicious and service was so friendly.  I ordered the tortellini stuffed with asparagus and ricotta in a prosciutto cream sauce and was blown away - perfect.  Give this place a try - you won't be disappointed.

TVeRWQLnT1kgqOYexTduxA.text: This was a great restaurant that is worth seeking out. My wife has a gluten allergy and it's hard to find places that accommodate. It is run by an Italian family and the owner has Celiac disease and has gluten free pasta versions of every dish on them menu. When you go there, you feel like family.

tGhZD5gdwVTGvE0u6T7_qA.text: Take the negative reviews for what they are, very specific gripes. We've been in London for 7 days, eaten at a variety of places, and THIS place is BY FAR the BEST place we've eaten! From the custom service to the fresh, delicious food to the reasonable prices to the delicious cappuccinos, it's amazing! I'm a foodie at heart and this place made me happy!!! It's a true gem. You should go out of your way to eat here. It'll make you happy!!!!

8dGisTxc9b-Ty6MIT-ZoDA.text: We were in London 5 yrs ago & found this little gem.  We were back this week & came for dinner twice...ok, three times.  We had 4 teens so the free WiFi was a hit.  More than that, the food is authentic, reasonably priced (for London) and the ambiance is quaint.  The owner says 'ciao Bella' as if we were right outside Rome.  Pizza, Caprese salad & gnocchi were the favorites.  House red is also very drinkable.

Fh_njJ8lm7Hu2MwzP4DXtg.text: My husband and I enjoyed the very delicious food and beautiful ambiance. I am gluten intolerant so I'm very glad I stumbled upon this place when I searched for gluten free food in London. I ordered the gluten free minestrone soup and lasagna, and my husband had the calzone. It was super delicious. Someone came around before we ordered to offer us bread. Lucky for me they also have gluten free bread, which was warm and very good. We also ordered the gluten free tiramisu for dessert and it was also very tasty. The wait staff was very professional and lovely. Thanks for a great visit and if we're ever in London again, we will make sure to come!

photos.caption: Photo of Cotto - London, United Kingdom. Gluten free lasagna and calzone

az2Xkd3L2m-QoSNmowhTyQ.text: I had the most uncomfortable, terrible and disappointing experience . I walked in with my family of six and was offered bread/butter. I politely replied, "no thank you," so the waitress gave me an ugly stare as if I've done something wrong. Terrible customer service to begin with. As our order arrived, we proceeded to eat. The food was ok, nothing special. The waitress then proceeded to stare at us the entire time we ate. Not a quick glance, I mean a HARD LONG STARE. I felt so uncomfortable ! I would take a bite and her eyes were looking straight at me. I would give this restaurant a zero star if it was possible. Please don't visit, stay away !

2t8hF9T3gE8BOlptXN1u4Q.text: If you are Celiac, you must go!! The owner/chef is Italian and has Celiac, so naturally the food is perfection.

VKwPDTxkq3eAjDvUqpkBcg.text: This is overpriced restuarant trap for the tourist. It charges for bread, adds a mandatory service charge with average food and  sub-par service. Unless gluten free is a big thing for you, find something better.

aNbmGKxYP0-b9_K8E6etXw.text: WOOOOOOW, this place is amazing, the food was so good and my wife who has Celiac was so excited to be able to eat real homemade pasta (gnocchi) and it was great. The PEOPLE there are even better than the food. So amazing, so nice, so caring.If you are in London do yourself a favor and go try them out.

a4WnGyrGlP-xpaQbVQQqew.text: Very good food and price is fair. Carbonara is a must eat. It is well located, in front of Lamberth North station. Easy to come and go.

BqvWSH7iqPoH8snKr_yIVw.text: Super cute family owned restaurant. It's very cozy inside. I meal came out hot and delicious. More food than what I thought I could eat. The people that work there are super friendly and hospitable! We even spent some time afterwards just chatting it up with the owners. So happy we came and met these wonderful people.

0ysuZGxX5M5Yb_MmxH4KqQ.text: On my last night in London my boyfriend took me here and I LOVED IT!!! by far the best Italian food I've had. The sauces  in both dishes were amazing! The owner and his family were so warm and welcoming. I would definitely recommend this place:)

4E9_soRk1VyCQwYi-XtgNQ.text: Very friendly and welcoming staff with food equally as good. The tiramisu is spectacular.

rBpybmI-Q4zB1yFP4K1Cpg.text: This is the best gluten free Italian food in all of London -scratch that the world. When I came to work in London I flew in from Bulgaria where I had just spent the last month with hardly any gluten free options. So when I discovered that Cotto was just walking distance from my hotel I freaked out and it was so good I almost ate there everyday!!! The owner was amazing also, you can tell how much he cares for his costumers. I just had to write a review for this place and want to come back just to eat here again!!!

k6DZDA3Y1nzzpHKx3IYb-Q.text: You poor gluten free eaters across the city. Give us thy daily bread? No thanks. You're either banished to Bibim Baps, have to trawl for corn tacos, or scour the city in search of good steak and frites. So, rare is it to dine with a dinner date and get their coel(iac) of approval; just as rare is it to find a dish that doesn't revolve around rice. So when multiple choices of wheat free wonders present, go head babes: take your time. Essentially Cotto have carb(on) copied everything off the regular menu and made special versions safe for those with less veritable villi. So as a place that prides itself on it its selection of gluten free pasta, I'd take time to treat your guests of gluten-free honour with the good grace to mull over the menu and avoid pestering guests whilst choosing said pasta. Saying that, said guest of honour at the table certainly enjoyed what Cotto has finally caught up to do, but personally I could see past the gluten free gimmick. I found an overly salty/ sweet theme repeated, a tinned tomato taste in the sauces, ubiquitous across most of the dishes delivered and sadly there was something wrong where the starter to mains ratio of sauces were also unequivocally uneven in how saucy they were presented. My octopi was drowned in a sea of sweet tomatoes, but to start it was an unexpectedly huge dish!Then for mains, a disappointingly dry lacklustre prawn linguini seemed lazily made. If only I combined the two?! Cotto is warm, inviting, homely, but dare I say, tired. Cotto could do with shaking up the menu a bit, I mean would it kill to serve some marrow, some fresh anchovies? Think about portion size, presentation?Safe to say I'll no less be going back in the new year with some mate who's going gluten free after the glut fest of Christmas. *eye roll emoji*

TNZtsXcMZXA0xTTjtVYcYA.text: Probably the best meal I had on our 14 day vacation to the UK.  Was hoping to eat there a second time but ran out of time.  Spaghetti Carbonara was the best I have had in a restaurant. Everyone else in our group enjoyed their meals and pricing was reasonable.  Small place that does take reservations.

kMNPFBUJ_5NuwcEiv8qtRQ.text: I've had gluten-free versions of various dishes at many establishments in multiple countries and this was one of the worst. Cardboard doughy pizza, terrible. It's like they just bought the dough from the frozen gluten free section of some giant chain supermarket and slipped some cheese (and in my case, cheap mushrooms) on it. I've made better gluten free products from just slipping a generic flour mix in a bowl with some baking soda. If the prices were half what they are, it would be more understandable, but oof..to make matters worse, they clearly didn't care or say anything when they took away the barely eaten pizza off my partner.  And, to add insult to injury, as others have written, the waitress will try to offer you bread several times and never mention they charge for it. It was only after I asked her multiple times, "I have heard you charge for the bread, is that correct?" That she purported to understand then walked away. This practice reminds me of how they try to pinch you at every corner in less developed countries. Was I really in London or was this all a bad dream? Our stomachs hurt afterwards and instead we grabbed from cheap sushi from inside Waterloo Station, and were immediately more content. Avoid!

IVLQdxuJZd2jbqSSm_Mq7Q.text: Really great restaurant! They took our reservation for 15 people for lunch with no problem, and all the food came out quickly. Wonderful, friendly service and great food. We particularly liked the freshly made pastas.

ol5UV-JFegvRPDFWUiYfGw.text: I went on a trip to London in late March of this year. We had checked out Cotto on Yelp a year before but couldn't make it before we left... so it became a high priority for us to go get their gluten-free pasta goodness before we return home.We journeyed by Underground to reach the restaurant and found it to be quite a walk from the Waterloo station but still worth the walk. Next time we'd take the extra time to transfer to the Bakerloo line since Lambeth is literally across the street. We were greeted by the owner who is the most delightful Italian man. He is celiac himself... so you can be certain that his gluten-free pasta is going to be on-point! He was excited to see someone in our party was gluten-free and shared his ideas on what the Mister should have for his dinner. The owner's warmth and excitement enhanced our entire experience and made the whole meal a perfect experience.Let's get onto the pasta... I am not celiac, so I didn't have to worry about gluten free. I settled on the regular fusilli con salicce with the house red. I found the pasta really good... but the sauce was where it was at! It was just absolutely delicious and I am sad I don't live in London so I could go all the time.We wrapped up our meal with some of the most delicious desserts... I chose the lemon sorbet.. served inside a hollowed out lemon coated in sugar and frozen. Yes, you read all of that correctly. If it's on the menu... get it!!So, whether you are a London local, or a tourist like me... whether you are celiac or a gluten-seeking fiend... check out Cotto and bring your appetite!

sS1fZBZl0HodvfhE4ArmIQ.text: Cozy little family-run Italian joint blocks from the bustling Waterloo station serves great, filling fare at a decent price for London. Given the small space, reservations are probably a good idea, although the place is very informal and casual. The website helpfully provides a link for such.Let's jump right in to say that the spaghetti carbonara ($13.60 at the current one Pound per $1.50ish exchange rate) was declared one of the best pasta dishes ever by one finicky pasta prude in our party. Mercifully light on the bacon -- really more like pancetta anyway in this rustic prep -- but with plenty of velvety egg yolk, the tight, rich serving was incredibly filling and satisfying.Next, the four-cheese penne ($16) -- just a very rich, hearty prep that really hit the spot for anyone looking for a big, warming entree. Finishing it under a broiler gave it just the the right amount of brown and chew. You will wobble home.More complex was the crespoline ($16.60), basically fresh pasta filled with spinach and ricotta cheese, topped with tomato sauce and baked. Think Italian enchiladas. Acid and cream and goodness. Very nice little dish.Pizza fans? The Vesuviana (tomato, mozzarella, homemade sausage and peppers $18.35) does feature some great sausage, but otherwise the price point seems a little high for the dish, almost like a tourist "pizza" premium is in effect.Desserts were aces across -- the tiramisu, mint ripple, and sorbets were all great finishes to a simple, honest dinner. Of note the sorbets arrived in wonderful little fresh citrus skins that clearly spoke to an attention to detail which would please any foodie.Finally -- the gluten free pasta options have been highly praised by other Yelpers, but were not sampled by our party. Might be a decision maker for you.Bottomline, looking for a simple, filling, pleasant evening meal on the south bank of the Thames -- give Cotto a go.

FlW--jiSUXI7YvEO3EmafQ.text: We have made multiple stops to Cotto over the years.  We love this hidden gem!  Fair priced, but high quality food.  Tonight we enjoyed two glasses of house wine, a bottle of still water, one bowl of pasta e fagoli, and order of tortellini and an order of spaghetti bolognese, we finished the night off with a piece of tiramisu; our total with service charge was £52.  The soup was excellent, priced around £6 a bowl, the portion size was generous.  A delicious broth with different types of beans and a lovely amount of pasta.  The spaghetti was a good portion size as well, good flavor, but I would've appreciated a little more meat in the bolognese sauce.  The tortellini was fantastic!! The cream sauce had a few layers of flavor that put the dish on the next level.  I'm typically not a huge prosciutto gal, but this was excellent.  The star of our meal was the tiramisu.  A fair sized slice, £5 a piece, we shared one and it was perfect.  Excellent flavor without being overbearing.We love this family owned restaurant and always make a point to go out of our way to dine here.  Probably my best ever Yelp! find.

XrHAYomINOKGIkkM9-al8A.text: So we've been traveling all over Europe for 2 weeks including 5 days in Italy and this Italian restaurant just outside our hotel in London our last night has the best food we've eaten. We had soup salad and pasta all of which were delicious. The service, the bread and the house wine were all amazing as well. I give them 5 stars.   The lasagna was the best I have ever tasted.

cJIz-p7E2V4Eyz6i5dfvRw.text: *** AVOID *** Tourist Scammers! ***feeling hunrgy after a long day touring the Roman Baths and The Ancient stonehedge is UK...we wandered off searching for a decent place to eat at 10pm at night...found this place while going to a chicken place...lol. we settled in and immediately i hear italian being spoken inside the restaurant. a good sign since it is being patronized by italian people inside. we quickly ordered some comfort food, spaghetti carbonara with bacon and cheese, cotto( ham) pizza,  and chicken risotto with tomato sauce! while waiting for food, the servers andowner came and said hi and made you feel at ease. 30secs later, the servers brings a basket full of sliced bread and butter and asks you: "you want some bread?" take some!!  now as a normal italian place does, table bread and butter is always free. i've been to many italian places even in dear Italy and bread is always free. we all took 1 piece each and butter. ( 4 of us) when the bill came, were were charged $1 pound /pax totalling $4 pounds. imagine for 1 sliced stale and cold and yucky pc of baguette. i complained to the manager who said.."oh, its on the menu we always charge!" then i said, no one told us and when the server brought the bread she never said if we take its an extra charge per person. she even justified it as its $1pound per person all you can eat bread!" im like, but i just took 1 slice and its not even good! all manager said was...thats the way it is. anyhow, i said its no use arguing over $4 pounds. if thats the way you guys do business then thats it. you are cheating your customers and specially us coz we are tourists. i say everywhere i go to italian place, bread is always free, even at high end places. she just shrugged us off! they even proudly displayed the YELP sticker on their window. what a shame!! another trick, so we ordered the bacon carbonara, and guess what topping they placed on the pasta...ham!! i said why ham the menu said bacon! the server insisted it was bacon! so again, another cost cutting and dark side  tricks they are using. lastly, the risotto was another big joke! they used white rice and just simmered it down to become sauce/soupy like the texture of risotto! only good thing was the most the pizza. my taste. uds and experience dont lie! but the service and scamming that they are running with the bread service, pasta, and God knows what else is shameful. they should take the Yelp sticker out!! Do not eat here! they will try and scan every last $ they can!

photos.caption: Photo of Cotto - London, United Kingdom. very good crust and cheese! thin and crispy and oozing with goodness.
Photo of Cotto - London, United Kingdom. does that look like risotto rice to you?  its white rice simmered and softened down w/the sauce to make it appear to be risotto!  big joke!
Photo of Cotto - London, United Kingdom. is that bacon to you??

YItpWQ0KHjA-b2iscCcYxg.text: We lucked upon this wonderful restaurant after a Bicycle London Tour. Our daughter is celiac and the owner was so hospitable and gracious. The food was delicious! We had the gluten free spaghetti bolognese, lasagna, 4 cheese penne, & margarita pizza. We ate every bite! Of course we were a bit hungry after our 3 hour bike tour:)

x173bGWdbhe0gTkUaoffKg.text: This is a great little Italian restaurant near Waterloo Station and around the corner from the Park Plaza Waterloo,Family run -- you can tell they bring care and quality to the food -- and a friendly welcome to all guests.We liked it so much - we tried it out twice the week we stayed in London.They bring spicy olives and bread to the table when you sit down.The house wine (red) is absolutely a great choice.We had the carbonara pasta the first time and the bolognese the second time.Very generous portions and it came nice and hot.They offered shredded parmesan for the meal.We had the lemon ice dessert the second time and was a great finish. The tiramisu looked great too.We will absolutely go again to this spot.Very reasonable too!

DdF8Qgty9P_tsLKyqjUM1w.text: Was really excited about this place but extremely underwhelmed. If you are gluten free and expecting an amazing feast, please know the following: all of the menu comes gluten free optional, all of the gluten free pastas are corn based- to me, hard to digest. There are 3 totally non corn - fresh pasta dishes, the ravioli, gnocchi and something else. Do not buy a gluten free pizza here. It was in edible. Do not get the bread, they charge you for it. Overall, we were not happy and would not return. Redeeming qualities - the celiac guy was friendly. The waitress was as well. The olive mix was nice and the facilities were clean.

4AnWG3dhciLSBn-fJwaRBA.text: Two L.A. girls who enjoyed our authentic Italian meal as well as the company of the owner.  It was my friend's birthday and he made us some delicious after dinner drink, on the house.

ihba9QY1UNj9TiosaF1W_w.text: Great experience from start to finish. Able to make a reservation 1 1/2 out. We got there early and were warmly greeted and sat. Owner personally chatted with us throughout the meal. Gluten free everything! It was amazing! The pasta was the best I ever had for gluten free. I even got ravioli- which is hardly ever a gf option. Delicious, relaxing, enjoyable around all around.

FSP8--aBUAsQRtytmCEQkw.text: We had a great authentic Italian meal here. The lasagna and spaghetti with bolognese sauce were delicious.  Their olives it's bread are spicy and unique. My wife went back a second time to eat here during our 5 day trip to London. Would recommend their house red wine.  The owner was very friendly and made sure we were enjoying the food.

3m0yfrqUaaWxnfPb9ETbFg.text: If you are gluten free and in London you MUST go here! The owner is a wonderful Italian man with celiacs who understands all the difficulties we usually face at restaurants trying to eat gluten free. He not only serves gluten free food, but he ensures it tastes great too! My gluten free ravioli was so wonderful I couldn't stop smiling all night. I was worried that the GF focus would make the "gluten full" food less tasty, but my boyfriend said his ravioli (gluten full) was very tasty as well. I can not recommend this restaurant more! It's a great value* for what you are getting and a truly wonderful experience. *For price context: we got a half bottle do wine, two ravioli entrees, bread and butter (one gf, one non-gf), GF tiramisu, and 2 cappuccinos for £59 (10% service fee included).

wLZ9HKFhclfmoClPxFrITA.text: Worst experience ever. They put olives and bread on the table without ordering them - but they charged for them. Regular bread hard and old. No pizzas available, no GF spaghetti available, no GF linguini available - 40% of the menu is unavailable!Melanzane flat. Change from paying with cash was incomplete. Will never go back.

J2t1iN7fQy0U6Bq2OhmUEw.text: As of writing this review, I am unable to review the food. I have been sitting at the restaurant for the better part of an hour and have seen multiple other tables be fed and catered to, but our food has yet to arrive. We have been assured two times by the owner that our food is up next, but I have seen at least three other tables be fed before us (despite us being seated and putting in our orders 20 or more minutes prior).The staff is cold and not helpful. It appeared that not ordering wine is a major downer on the service at this business and will result in less than stellar service.Edit: food finally came. It was really good! The salad had no dressing or oil, but otherwise I was very pleased. If only the service wasn't so horrid, it would rate at least three stars

TljS9svhZ2lyZ5fcf3QR5g.text: I was impressed how many of the dishes were gluten free. My eggplant pasta was good and my husband loved the gluten free mushroom pasta. The owners easily accommodated us on a busy Friday night and they were really friendly, engaging us in conversation. They took a lot of pride in their food and service. I highly recommend.

photos.caption: Photo of Cotto - London, United Kingdom. Eggplant pasta
Photo of Cotto - London, United Kingdom. Gluten free mushroom pasta

jSci8j1OpJpJZnZ-Vj62Ig.text: After visiting the London Eye, my brother, my nieces and I stopped in to eat. The manager/ owner(?) was really friendly and talked to us about our ethnic background. This place does not have many beer options, but they do have many liquors on tap. My brother and I shared a Salame pizza and Tortelloni panna e prosciutto and both were really good. I'd definitely go back to this place to eat again.

photos.caption: Photo of Cotto - London, United Kingdom. A peak at the menu
Photo of Cotto - London, United Kingdom. Tortelloni panna e prosciutto (after we took a bite. It looks prettier when you first get it). Soooo good!!
Photo of Cotto - London, United Kingdom. Salame pizza, spicy (but really not that spicy). Really good!!

y4wc7kQD65x2xqXQ5WAbeg.text: Greetings. I hope you appreciate this review before you are subjected to a very rude service.This is based on two couples experience on a cold december night. We went to this place and ordered a mozzarella apetizer and pizza to start while we decided for our main entre and wine selection. Our order was taken by the main patron who appeared to be the owner. He also took with him all menus.After our apetizer and pizza arived we asked the server for a second menu which he provided with the following remarks: "you should have ordered all at once... see, we do not like to go back and forth" To our surprise, the patron was talking to the three tables across about us and telling the rest of the restaurant guests that we had only ordered two things which was not enough to pay the service for the table... All of this while the server was in essence refusing our order and kicking us out... By that time we had all eyes on us... this while the owner continued making unprofessional, unethical, and erroneous coments about us. This is the kind of service you should expect at this place. This type of establishment is a disgrace to the restaurant industry,  Londoners and Italian family culture and values.Arrogance, disrespect, disgusting attitude, unprofessionalism, unethical services, etc... all you are certaint to experience at this place. By the way, i left £20 tip and the guy didnt even say thank you. I guess they really needed it. Do yourself a favor and go to a Pub and have an authentic London experience.

D9bmiA-cPbcTIng9tull4A.text: solid locally-owned Italian food. The owner is a lovely man who makes all guests feel at home. Order off the homemade pasta menu or the pizza; we found both extra exceptional!

V68F-DsjFU00WIt6wir0GA.text: Amazing food. The staff is friendly. The owner is wonderful and.... yes... we will eat here again! Wonderful pastas!

JeJBOza3YYe6FHPxRyBrSA.text: My husband and I stopped in here for dinner and both were impressed with our pasta dishes. The owner checked in with us a few times and was very friendly. We felt like we were in eating dinner in Italy.

t_e7FWgG-SbCaIM3HwM3Sw.text: the four cheese pasta is average.  the spinach salad is awful, the trout is just marginally pass.  not recommended

a1w5UREPVh7G1TCX_GfPLA.text: i ate here a few years ago but i still think about it all the time. most amazing GLUTEN FREE italian food. great service from a family owned business. we had a great meal and tried lots of various gf dishes. each dish was magically wonderful. i hope to return to london and cotto sometime soon!
